title: Pickled Eggs with Beets "Nanny's Purple Eggs"
description: My grandmother always had these at holidays, especially Easter. I found out later it is a Mennonite dish.
directions: Peel, quarter or slice, and cook beets. (skip if using canned beets)
Put eggs and beets in glass or crockery bowl or jar (no metal!)
Pour vinegar over the eggs and beets.
Add olive oil, herbs, salt, and pepper.
Pour water in. Liquid should cover the eggs and beets.
If it doesn't cover, taste to determine if you should add more water or more vinegar. (It should be fairly sour.)
Let sit overnight in fridge. The longer the eggs soak, the more pickled (and purple) they will be. They can keep in the fridge for a long time.
